The ArtBox Institute is a business training and professional development program for creatives, arts administrators and artists of any medium, any age, at any stage of a career. The ArtBox Institute (ABI) is designed to provide tools and resources to navigate the business challenges of the contemporary marketplace. The curriculum is calibrated to provide a professional foundation built on acquiring practical skills for the marketplace, increasing confidence and actively participating in a community.

Healer2Healer is an international organization based in New York City that brings volunteer alternative medicine practitioners - such as acupuncturists, Reiki practitioners, and medical massage therapists - to rural indigenous communities.I met with Healer2Healer in the Amazon jungle of Peru from August 13th - August 29th. In addition to five days of Community Clinic in Cahuide, Peru where H2H participants worked triage to treat 400 patients from the local area, we:· Took part in indigenous ceremonies,· participated in perma-culture activities,· stayed at and learned about The Paititi Institute for the Preservation for the Amazonian Rainforest and Indigenous Culture,· experienced lectures about healing on many levels and modalities,· and studied indigenous traditions and natural medicine.I also taught yoga at the Paititi Institute.This was an opportunity for me to aid and learn from a population that is un(der)-represented and often marginalized. I also had the chance to learn and deepen my own healing practice and skills, and evolve as a human/spiritual being.

I wanted to express my gratitude in regards to Holly Troy and Printing Services.Holly has repeatedly gone above and beyond, providing outstanding customer service with our department and other NAU related projects. She is quick to respond to communications and eagerly answers questions. Holly is an expert in her job, providing valued recommendations to help guide any project. She is highly appreciated for her skills that she provides. Her positive attitude in both online communications and in-person is contagious.One example, Holly and Printing Services excepted a print job that needed special bindery needs two days before the Christmas break. This project was quoted and printed within a few hours – making my client meet their event deadline. Outstanding service on such short notice.Thank you for being such a great contact and resource on campus.

To Whom It May Concern:Holly Troy is an incredibly efficient professional, skilled as an administrative assistant on an executive level, an example of of her strong organizational skills. She markets and directs her own business, and assists other entrepreneurs. Her skill in marketing is derived from her training at Hunter College in the Fine Arts Department, one of the top Fine Arts Departments in the nation, working in assisting faculty. She has continued as an executive assistant for a department at Northern Arizona University assisting faculty. Throughout this time she also worked three other jobs as a salesperson for the Amazon Herb Company, a company she strongly believes in, as  a yoga instructor, and as a Reiki healer. Holly and I both worked in health foods and vitamins for Health Shoppe for several years at the beginning of our careers, while I used an environmental pedagogy and permaculture principals to inform my constructivist teaching practice, Holly has used this background to grow as a healer and promoter of alternative health care to those suffering from various ailments.Recently, she has used her skills as an entrepreneur to begin promoting her holistic therapeutic skills with her own on-line courses, designed to allow participants to use writing skills to promote their own healing with yoga practices.Holly is an positive team player, who is self-directed towards wellness for herself and others. She makes a fine addition to any company, and brings determination and holistic wellness in all her activities.                                  Sincerely,                                  Randi Taylor-Habib                                  (503) 515 -8879

Darrell Marlatt
Vendor Management Systems Account Manager at Colliers Intl Valuation & Advisory Services
January 1, 2008, Darrell worked with Holly in different groups

Holly was an Executive Assistant for a department of Macquarie Bank that was extremely demanding, requiring a high level of detail oriented work to be completed in an efficient and timely manner.  The results of her work were crucial for my department, as we processed high levels and dollar amounts of invoices to be paid to vendors, along with expense reimbursements to be paid to employees.  Dealing with over a dozen departments in our New York office, along with 10 offices around the US, I can tell you that Holly was the most dependable Executive I had the pleasure to deal with; always submitting clear, organized and accurate paperwork that allowed my group to process payments promptly and without worries that the company assets would be compromised because of careless work.  Any company would be fortunate to have Holly as an employee.  Along with her abilities stated above, she brings a wonderful attitude and personality with an ability to work with very difficult personalities in a fast-paced environment.  I strongly recommend Holly as she would be a valuable asset for any company that values professionalism, teamwork and quality of work.

Jon Anderson, UXC
Relentless user advocate, UX evangelist and all-around good guy
May 2, 2013, Holly worked with Jon in different groups

I have had the pleasure of working with Jon on various projects through the Marketing Department at Northern Arizona University. The most recent was "EDEN" in which Jon was the primary user experience designer for an overall new University website design and 70+ departmental websites with integrated applications. Because of Jon's leadership and ability, I was confident in arranging content and design focus groups with every department and college at the university (as many people were initially resistent to change, this was not a task not for the faint of heart). I knew we had a winning design and framework, and successfully informed clients of the web design improvements step-by-step—with Jon's clear project outline, our team was able to develop an extensive project execution plan, and I was able to help clients enthusiastically visualize their new sites and to offer them a distinct timeframe of project tasks and completion.I have learned a lot from Jon. His natural enthusiasm for his work makes him an excellent teacher—he takes the time to answer questions and to offer different examples until he is certain the question is answered. He is very personable and always enjoyable to work with.

Stephanie McCarthy
Graphic Design | Front-end Web Designer | Marketing | Promotions
August 10, 2009, Holly was a client of Stephanie’s

Stephanie offers work "for your graphic or web design pleasures . . . " - and it truly is a pleasure working with her. From the moment I sit down with her to discuss a graphic concept she is focused, listening, taking notes, and sketching out ideas. She knows exactly what kinds of questions to ask in order to find out what I truly want. The finished product is much more amazing than I could have ever imagined myself; working with Stephanie is truly co-creating. Her work is cutting edge, visually appealing, and (for me) fun. She created my business cards two years ago, and recently, my meditation cd cover, and is currently working on my web site. I will hire Stephanie every time I need graphic help; I couldn't recommend her enough!

summary: Creativity and viewing the world from a variety of perspectives is essential to sustainability. I like altering my reality through imagination, playing with color, movement, and breath — and I help others do the same through yoga and the workshop Writing the Energetic Body, a practice of “exploring writing through the lens of the chakra system."My work is a physical response to my relationship with Nature and how I move through it. I’m not satisfied with skittering along the surface, with looking at the world from a distance—I have to dive in, get dirty. Whether I’m mountain biking, meditating, writing or painting, I explore the edges, the places of shift and change, where the thin quiver of constant movement along boundaries is almost unseen. Pushing the edge requires being in the moment; it can be prickly, sharp, and jagged—it can also be fun, expansive, and sublime. My work often begins as a meditation in agitation. Pressing the surface of discomfort, moving with the medium, creates a shift. The result is playful and raw. I know a piece is done when I step back and find myself dancing.
name: Holly Troy
